author: lgo
msg: On the 1.3.x branch:
Merge all pending testsuite inmprovements from trunk:
r1998: new unit test for ssl tunnel authentication
r2006: test_server: add missing return value
r2030: Fix issue in CuTest test framework.
r2043: Check that certificate and key file loaded successfully.
r2055+r2064: Fix segfault in the test suite.
r2056: Fix compilation warning.
r2060: Resolve two segfaults on Windows
r2062: Fix ssl tests on Windows by moving  BROKEN_WSAPOLL to serf_private.h
r2065: Fix ssl IO in test server

author: rhuijben
msg: Properly handle a few cases where openssl says that it needs further IO on the
underlying network. This avoids breaking the network connection when we don't
have to.
Add a ### comment to document that we might check the wrong error as in theory
reads may cause writes on the network layer and writes can cause reads.
* buckets/ssl_buckets.c
(ssl_decrypt): Add comment and handle the theoretical SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE.
(ssl_encrypt): Add comment.
* server/test_sslserver.c
(ssl_handshake): Handle SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL, as just returning an error causes
15 tests to fail on my Windows machine.

author: lgo
msg: Follow up to r2055: Fix segfault in the test suite.
* test/server/test_server.c
(proxy_replay): Create servctx->servstream when needed.

author: rhuijben
msg: Fix running the bucket tests on Windows, by using the static library build
instead of a combination of the shared library build and certain direct
object files.
This had the nice side effect of adding a second definition of
"serf_buckets_are_v2", outside 'serf-2.dll'
* SConstruct
- Pass existing $PATH to check.py, to allow running tests on Windows.
- Link to the static library name on Windows.
(This doesn't have side effects on other platforms because the
serf library name for shared and static libraries are identical there)
- Remove explicit linking to bucket/*.c from the tests.

author: rhuijben
msg: Fix the failing authz tests with 'Connection: close' on Windows, by moving
the define of BROKEN_WSAPOLL to serf_private.h, to also use this value in
test_server.c, which already expected its definition.
* context.c
(BROKEN_WSAPOLL): Move definition from here to...
* serf_private.h
(BROKEN_WSAPOLL): ... here.
